title: Kate Middleton said the sweetest thing to Princess Charlotte on her first day at school
text:
From Cosmopolitan

Princess Charlotte started school at Thomas' Battersea yesterday, and was accompanied by her parents and brother, George.

Kate Middleton tried to help calm her daughter with some words of encouragement.

Princess Charlotte didn't appear to be as nervous yesterday as her older brother was when he started at Thomas' Battersea back in 2017, but she must have been feeling the pressure slightly, as mum Kate Middleton was caught whispering some words of encouragement to her daughter.

The Duchess, who held Charlotte's hand as she arrived at the school ready to meet her teacher, appeared to say: "George will help lead the way."

“George will help lead the way” 🥺 pic.twitter.com/LbhXYoQkKA — Tea Time With The Cambridges (@TeaCambridges) September 5, 2019

SO. SWEET.

Charlotte was clearly leaning on her older sibling for support throughout the day. Despite her appearing to be the more confident sibling in most situations, George has plenty of experience at Thomas', and his big brother instincts surely kicked in.

According to Hello! magazine, George regularly looks out for his younger sister. "Prince George is a very protective and lovely older brother," royal biographer Penny Junor said. "I'm sure he'll look after his little sister and take great pride in showing her the ropes."

Judging by the sweet picture released by Kensington Palace yesterday, in which Charlotte had her arm tightly wrapped around George, she'll be sticking close to him.

And, as People previously reported, the young royals are incredibly close with each other. "They are close in age, and they spend so much time together," a source said. "Playdates [with outsiders] can be tricky, so they learn to lean on each other."

Awww.
